HDG.IM.content: science of history doesn’t determine originary relation to history, already presupposes such a relation [digression on history]: science of history can never institute historical relation to history
HDG.IM.linkedContent: science of history doesn’t determine originary relation to history, already presupposes such a relation [digression on history]: science of history can never institute historical relation to history

HDG.IM.content: asking of the fundamental metaphysical question is historical: opens up happening of human Dasein in its essential relations > opens to futures to come (Zu-künften), thus binds back to inception > a non-derivative call/summoning of Dasein to its history, call to make a decision
HDG.IM.linkedContent: asking of the fundamental metaphysical question is historical: opens up happening of human Dasein in its essential relations > opens to futures to come (Zu-künften), thus binds back to inception > a non-derivative call/summoning of Dasein to its history, call to make a decision

HDG.BC.content: man, ready for what is always original, or knows better > universal currency of historiological science, calculating “attitude” toward history, begins w/ ascendancy of Christianity: relation to essential reckoned into otherwise calculable
HDG.BC.linkedContent: man, ready for what is always original, or knows better > universal currency of historiological science, calculating “attitude” toward history, begins w/ ascendancy of Christianity: relation to essential reckoned into otherwise calculable

HDG.BC.content: essential [the earlier?] has its own history (Geschichte), not calculable acc. ciphers (Marken) “new” & “old” [not new, but originary]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: essential [the earlier?] has its own history (Geschichte), not calculable acc. ciphers (Marken) “new” & “old” [not new, but originary]

HDG.BC.content: Greeks as the earliest: originality/bindingness for our history, impending historical decisions: we name the “earliest” the incipient (das Anfängliche) > remembrance of inception can transport us into essential [many/herd misconstrues essential power, fails to hear]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Greeks as the earliest: originality/bindingness for our history, impending historical decisions: we name the “earliest” the incipient (das Anfängliche) > remembrance of inception can transport us into essential [many/herd misconstrues essential power, fails to hear]

HDG.BC.content: [phony inheritance] love of antiquity pretext to evade every decisive reflection > readiness to confront inception more vital than knowledge of any languages [but still must know Greek?] > readiness can originate as genuine (echte) only from necessities of history in which we’re placed: insistence on possession of truth makes remembrance of inception impossible
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [phony inheritance] love of antiquity pretext to evade every decisive reflection > readiness to confront inception more vital than knowledge of any languages [but still must know Greek?] > readiness can originate as genuine (echte) only from necessities of history in which we’re placed: insistence on possession of truth makes remembrance of inception impossible

HDG.BC.content: resolve to attain essential knowing [to-come] need not, at first, concern itself w/ inception of our history [how so?] > applying to ourselves the test of whether we are setting out on path of reflection: inner freedom
HDG.BC.linkedContent: resolve to attain essential knowing [to-come] need not, at first, concern itself w/ inception of our history [how so?] > applying to ourselves the test of whether we are setting out on path of reflection: inner freedom

HDG.BC.content: for inception of our history [contra will of modern technology], for Greeks, decline was unique, momentary, laudable, great > decline of unique vs. perishing, clinging fast to the ordinary > what is imperishable [indestructible] in inception: rarity/singularity of each varied return of what is originary w/in it > experience of inception: realize what essentially came to be known at inception itself > the thought-worthy [value]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: for inception of our history [contra will of modern technology], for Greeks, decline was unique, momentary, laudable, great > decline of unique vs. perishing, clinging fast to the ordinary > what is imperishable [indestructible] in inception: rarity/singularity of each varied return of what is originary w/in it > experience of inception: realize what essentially came to be known at inception itself > the thought-worthy [value]

HDG.BC.content: [do we belong anywhere at all?] to merely anticipate (ahnen) where we could belong: necessary to experience ourselves: “ourselves” re: what determines us, is other than us, but governs us [totally other?]: (we call this arbitrarily at first [willkürlich zunächst]) the inception of our history
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [do we belong anywhere at all?] to merely anticipate (ahnen) where we could belong: necessary to experience ourselves: “ourselves” re: what determines us, is other than us, but governs us [totally other?]: (we call this arbitrarily at first [willkürlich zunächst]) the inception of our history

HDG.BC.content: history (arbitrarily), happening (Ereignis) of a decision about essence of truth, Ereignis is exceptional > man fails to see/recognize simple history: confused/habituated to multiplicity of ordinary [Mitsein] > remembrance of the inception: readiness for what is to come > distinguish what does matter from what doesn’t (groundless): let us allow ourselves to be struck by incipient
HDG.BC.linkedContent: history (arbitrarily), happening (Ereignis) of a decision about essence of truth, Ereignis is exceptional > man fails to see/recognize simple history: confused/habituated to multiplicity of ordinary [Mitsein] > remembrance of the inception: readiness for what is to come > distinguish what does matter from what doesn’t (groundless): let us allow ourselves to be struck by incipient

HDG.BC.content: [against science of history] interpret everything from what has been: human inertia
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [against science of history] interpret everything from what has been: human inertia

HDG.BC.content: [slow down] no way out in any direction: Being cast itself toward us—in saying something about Being, we cast it away > perceive the impasse into which Being places us as a sign pointing toward where we already are placed, since we comport ourselves toward beings [presuppositions? also, what is a sign if you already know its parent?] [rather than impasse as aporia: impasse is what it is] > concealed abode, to which essence of our history owes its origin, abode that concerns our essence
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [slow down] no way out in any direction: Being cast itself toward us—in saying something about Being, we cast it away > perceive the impasse into which Being places us as a sign pointing toward where we already are placed, since we comport ourselves toward beings [presuppositions? also, what is a sign if you already know its parent?] [rather than impasse as aporia: impasse is what it is] > concealed abode, to which essence of our history owes its origin, abode that concerns our essence

HDG.BC.content: [alibis] “have done (fertig)” w/ Being by appealing to this/that being (avoid abode [of Being]) > abode (Aufenhaltes) [of Being] contains an exacting expectation (Zumutung), demand to experience abode of historical man, originates from claim of Being itself, claim comes from still-concealed essence of history > a strange demand, don’t minimize [lose hold] of this strangeness (Befremdlichkeit), we need history itself to make us remember, give us hints for reflection, a reflection that grants us remembrance of 1st inception of Western thought [strangeness as trace] > why is that? only inception itself can tell us [heterotautology?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [alibis] “have done (fertig)” w/ Being by appealing to this/that being (avoid abode [of Being]) > abode (Aufenhaltes) [of Being] contains an exacting expectation (Zumutung), demand to experience abode of historical man, originates from claim of Being itself, claim comes from still-concealed essence of history > a strange demand, don’t minimize [lose hold] of this strangeness (Befremdlichkeit), we need history itself to make us remember, give us hints for reflection, a reflection that grants us remembrance of 1st inception of Western thought [strangeness as trace] > why is that? only inception itself can tell us [heterotautology?]

HDG.BC.content: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]

HDG.TB.content: [the sending & what is sent] history of Being, destiny of Being, the sending & It which sends forth hold back w/ their self-manifestation, hold back as epoche, thus we can speak of epochs of destiny of Being > [method] gradual removal of these obscuring covers [epochs]
HDG.TB.linkedContent: [the sending & what is sent] history of Being, destiny of Being, the sending & It which sends forth hold back w/ their self-manifestation, hold back as epoche, thus we can speak of epochs of destiny of Being > [method] gradual removal of these obscuring covers [epochs]

HDG.BT.content: destruction not negative (purpose not to bury past in nullity (Nichtigkeit), stakes out positive possibilities of that tradition, must keep it w/in its limits [?] > destruction only re: stages of history of ontology that are in principle decisive [epochal thought]
HDG.BT.linkedContent: destruction not negative (purpose not to bury past in nullity (Nichtigkeit), stakes out positive possibilities of that tradition, must keep it w/in its limits [?] > destruction only re: stages of history of ontology that are in principle decisive [epochal thought]

HDG.BT.content: [destruction already has focal points at which to aim [?]: Interpretation of Being, phenomenon of time in history of ontology]
HDG.BT.linkedContent: [destruction already has focal points at which to aim [?]: Interpretation of Being, phenomenon of time in history of ontology]

HDG.WM.content: a history of nothing: from Greek [?] ex nihilo nihil fit (from nothing, nothing comes to be) to Christian dogma ex nihilo fit—ens creatum (from nothing comes—created being) (nothing indicates fundamental conception of beings [here, as counterconcept to summum ens, God as ens increatum?]) > God & nothing [Augustine]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: a history of nothing: from Greek [?] ex nihilo nihil fit (from nothing, nothing comes to be) to Christian dogma ex nihilo fit—ens creatum (from nothing comes—created being) (nothing indicates fundamental conception of beings [here, as counterconcept to summum ens, God as ens increatum?]) > God & nothing [Augustine]

HDG.WM.content: presumed soberness of mind, superiority of science: laughable when doesn’t take nothing seriously > it’s only because nothing is manifest that science can make beings themselves objects of investigation > new task of science (its essential task) to exist on basis of metaphysics, disclose entire expanse of truth in nature & history [?]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: presumed soberness of mind, superiority of science: laughable when doesn’t take nothing seriously > it’s only because nothing is manifest that science can make beings themselves objects of investigation > new task of science (its essential task) to exist on basis of metaphysics, disclose entire expanse of truth in nature & history [?]

HDG.QB.content: overcoming nihilism not standing outside of nihilism if essence of nihilism isn’t nihilistic, if history of that essence is older and remains younger [than phases of nihilism]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: overcoming nihilism not standing outside of nihilism if essence of nihilism isn’t nihilistic, if history of that essence is older and remains younger [than phases of nihilism]

HDG.FS.content: unthinkable/unachievable that human no longer corresponds to what appears > in age of world impoverishment (in der Verarmung der Welt), only see chemical processes > Descartes not part of this, the 1st to see lightning flash, what is decisive (Entscheidende): das er gesehen werde > can’t know why it gave itself in this way, at least know in scientific sense: “destiny of being” not history as succession of events
HDG.FS.linkedContent: unthinkable/unachievable that human no longer corresponds to what appears > in age of world impoverishment (in der Verarmung der Welt), only see chemical processes > Descartes not part of this, the 1st to see lightning flash, what is decisive (Entscheidende): das er gesehen werde > can’t know why it gave itself in this way, at least know in scientific sense: “destiny of being” not history as succession of events

HDG.FS.content: for Husserl, deep meaning of history as Tradition did not exist, where Plato/Aristotle are present to us, must be present to us, speak to us
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Husserl, deep meaning of history as Tradition did not exist, where Plato/Aristotle are present to us, must be present to us, speak to us

HDG.FS.content: [Heidegger going to clarify misunderstandings of Seinsfrage] > history of metaphysics has given many answers to Seinsfrage, e.g. Aristotle say energeia, not upokeimenon, latter an interpretation of beings not Being [upokeimenon as presencing (Anwesen) of island, the being as it lets itself be seen, island lies in sea]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [Heidegger going to clarify misunderstandings of Seinsfrage] > history of metaphysics has given many answers to Seinsfrage, e.g. Aristotle say energeia, not upokeimenon, latter an interpretation of beings not Being [upokeimenon as presencing (Anwesen) of island, the being as it lets itself be seen, island lies in sea]

HDG.FS.content: since history of metaphysics presents history of concealment of being, we can now think history of being itself and make a beginning w/next step: taking-into-view being as being
HDG.FS.linkedContent: since history of metaphysics presents history of concealment of being, we can now think history of being itself and make a beginning w/next step: taking-into-view being as being

HDG.FS.content: thinking Ereignis w/ concepts of Being, history of Being, won’t be successful, nor w/ assistance of the Greek (something “to go beyond” [Nietzsche on Socrates]) > Mit dem Sein verschwindet auch die ontologische Differenz [w/ Being, ontological difference vanishes: i.e. Ereignis goes beyond both?]: ontological difference (1927-1936) a necessary impasse (Holzweg)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: thinking Ereignis w/ concepts of Being, history of Being, won’t be successful, nor w/ assistance of the Greek (something “to go beyond” [Nietzsche on Socrates]) > Mit dem Sein verschwindet auch die ontologische Differenz [w/ Being, ontological difference vanishes: i.e. Ereignis goes beyond both?]: ontological difference (1927-1936) a necessary impasse (Holzweg)

HDG.FS.content: can man bring about all these imperatives & could he break them himself? Marxism & sociology name the “imperatives”—to which we are compelled today > Heidegger gathers then in name Ge-stell, most extreme form of history of metaphysics, of the destiny of being, from epoch of objectivity to orderability, no longer objects only “consumer goods” at disposal of every consumer [w/out objectivity, is there no more consciousness?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: can man bring about all these imperatives & could he break them himself? Marxism & sociology name the “imperatives”—to which we are compelled today > Heidegger gathers then in name Ge-stell, most extreme form of history of metaphysics, of the destiny of being, from epoch of objectivity to orderability, no longer objects only “consumer goods” at disposal of every consumer [w/out objectivity, is there no more consciousness?]

HDG.FS.content: there is a return to beginning in Being and Time, but it is through destruction, dismantling, disintegration (Auflösung) (which is sometimes awkward [ungeschickt] [?]) of what is destined as being in metaphysics > not yet in Being and Time a genuine knowledge of history of being, hence the awkwardness, naiveté of “ontological destruction” > since then, unavoidable naiveté of novice gave way to a knowing [he arrived, no more destruction?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: there is a return to beginning in Being and Time, but it is through destruction, dismantling, disintegration (Auflösung) (which is sometimes awkward [ungeschickt] [?]) of what is destined as being in metaphysics > not yet in Being and Time a genuine knowledge of history of being, hence the awkwardness, naiveté of “ontological destruction” > since then, unavoidable naiveté of novice gave way to a knowing [he arrived, no more destruction?]

HDG.CCP.content: [math & science unfold man’s historical character] any examination that focuses on what is part of history must be historical > a broad sense of history, historical rests in Gegnet > nothing but wait for man’s nature [not realized in rationality of animal?] in releasement to Gegnet, which conceals its own nature > we presage [lookup] Gelassenheit as sought for thinking [no arrival?] > we will non-willing when we let ourselves into Gelassenheit of Gegnet
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: [math & science unfold man’s historical character] any examination that focuses on what is part of history must be historical > a broad sense of history, historical rests in Gegnet > nothing but wait for man’s nature [not realized in rationality of animal?] in releasement to Gegnet, which conceals its own nature > we presage [lookup] Gelassenheit as sought for thinking [no arrival?] > we will non-willing when we let ourselves into Gelassenheit of Gegnet

HDG.DL.content: confusion [nihilistic reading of Heidegger] re: name “Being,” because belongs to patrimony (Eigentum) of Sprache of metaphysics > bring out essence of metaphysics: bring metaphysics w/in its own limits > overcoming metaphysics: neither destruction (Zerstörung) nor denial (Verleugnung) of metaphysics (intend anything else would be childish, demean history)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: confusion [nihilistic reading of Heidegger] re: name “Being,” because belongs to patrimony (Eigentum) of Sprache of metaphysics > bring out essence of metaphysics: bring metaphysics w/in its own limits > overcoming metaphysics: neither destruction (Zerstörung) nor denial (Verleugnung) of metaphysics (intend anything else would be childish, demean history)

HDG.LP.content: [Heidegger discusses the relation btwn clarification (Erläuterung) of poem and discussion (Erörterung)] to discuss must pass through clarification, any right clarification [another version of authenticity] presupposes discussion: thinking dialogue (denkende Zwiesprache) w/ Gedicht remains (verharrt) w/in reciprocity (Wechselbezug) btwn clarification/discussion > only poetic dialogue w/ Gedicht is true dialogue: poetic conversation (Gespräch) btwn poets
HDG.LP.linkedContent: [Heidegger discusses the relation btwn clarification (Erläuterung) of poem and discussion (Erörterung)] to discuss must pass through clarification, any right clarification [another version of authenticity] presupposes discussion: thinking dialogue (denkende Zwiesprache) w/ Gedicht remains (verharrt) w/in reciprocity (Wechselbezug) btwn clarification/discussion > only poetic dialogue w/ Gedicht is true dialogue: poetic conversation (Gespräch) btwn poets

HDG.WL.content: diversity of elements in language, an original count (Zählen) not yet enumerable, a belonging together shows itself (ergab sich) > the count is a recounting that anticipates (auf vorblickt) the Einigende im Zusammengëhoren, but can’t make it appear > long history of inability to experience unifying unity of Sprachwesens, thus it remains w/out a name
HDG.WL.linkedContent: diversity of elements in language, an original count (Zählen) not yet enumerable, a belonging together shows itself (ergab sich) > the count is a recounting that anticipates (auf vorblickt) the Einigende im Zusammengëhoren, but can’t make it appear > long history of inability to experience unifying unity of Sprachwesens, thus it remains w/out a name

HDG.EC.content: World War only consequence of devastation [ontological history]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: World War only consequence of devastation [ontological history]

HDG.OHF.content: re: Aristotle’s Peri Ermēneias, solely important [in this context] re: history of meaning of word: discourse (Rede) makes something accessible (zugänglich), brings out into open, ready to hand (vorhanden) > thus logos has distinctive possibility of alētheuein (being-true), making what was concealed unconcealed [comes to light through logos]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: re: Aristotle’s Peri Ermēneias, solely important [in this context] re: history of meaning of word: discourse (Rede) makes something accessible (zugänglich), brings out into open, ready to hand (vorhanden) > thus logos has distinctive possibility of alētheuein (being-true), making what was concealed unconcealed [comes to light through logos]

HDG.OHF.content: [history of the concept of “Man”] 1) living being endowed w/ reason (via Aristotle) 2) person or personhood (Christian explication guided by Revelation in Old Testament) > but logos never meant “reason” for Aristotle, but discourse (Rede), conversation (Gespräch): man as a being that has its world in mode (Weise) of something addressed (der Angesprochenen) [man in language]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [history of the concept of “Man”] 1) living being endowed w/ reason (via Aristotle) 2) person or personhood (Christian explication guided by Revelation in Old Testament) > but logos never meant “reason” for Aristotle, but discourse (Rede), conversation (Gespräch): man as a being that has its world in mode (Weise) of something addressed (der Angesprochenen) [man in language]

HDG.OHF.content: [historical human sciences shouldn’t imitate history of art?]

[history of phenomenology] phenomenon, distinctive mode of being an object (shows itself, not merely represented): being-present as an object from out of itself (das von ihm selbst her Präsentsein eines Gegenstandes) > certain modes of the object that aren’t genuine can still be factically dominant
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [history of phenomenology] phenomenon, distinctive mode of being an object (shows itself, not merely represented): being-present as an object from out of itself (das von ihm selbst her Präsentsein eines Gegenstandes) > certain modes of the object that aren’t genuine can still be factically dominant

HDG.OHF.content: [history of human sciences & philosophy orienting themselves in 19th century toward demarcation (Abgrenzung) of natural sciences, following Kant?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [history of human sciences & philosophy orienting themselves in 19th century toward demarcation (Abgrenzung) of natural sciences, following Kant?]

HDG.OHF.content: since Parmenides [does his reading of Parmenides change?], “perceptual mean-ing (vernehmendes Vermeinen)” and Being are the same [noien and einai], 1st fundamental insight (Grundeinsicht) of idealism (traditional ontology/logic stand w/in the fate of Parmenidean interpretation) (no accident Husserl still characterizing intentionality as “noetic”) > recovering (Gewinnung) a primordial situation presupposes critique of development of intellectual history
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: since Parmenides [does his reading of Parmenides change?], “perceptual mean-ing (vernehmendes Vermeinen)” and Being are the same [noien and einai], 1st fundamental insight (Grundeinsicht) of idealism (traditional ontology/logic stand w/in the fate of Parmenidean interpretation) (no accident Husserl still characterizing intentionality as “noetic”) > recovering (Gewinnung) a primordial situation presupposes critique of development of intellectual history
